column4: i'm having porblems instaling ubunto 10.10 from the cd in a p3 500mhz
i get to the menu to pick the language, and after chosing install option i just get a black screen
how long did you wait?
5 minutes
it will likely take hours to load, try the alternate installer
thanks. but i don't have any linux skills the instalation will also be user friendlly?
its not that hard
not good at all
just to confirm pc3200 512MB ddr doesnt fit in the pentium 3 board?
a p3 500mhz isnt going to run ubuntu desktop very well
i discovered that a few minutos ago when reading the system requirements, do you recomend another distro?
ubuntu-server
well anything graphical isnt going to be very good, no server dosent have a graphical enviroment
i guess your stuck with ubuntu-desktop, you wont get any beter performance from a different distro
it would make a good machine to run a remote desktop from
can you give a bit more detail
while loading up ubuntu in recoverymode>regular startup, i receive a post with severel services, and the inictl event says failed
is it causing a problem for you?
i dont know, but it apears to be working
you can ignore it, initctl is a relic from the old sysvinit
the root account is disabled in ubuntu
no, use sudo instead
i had the ubuntu running in the p3 500. shut down the computer, started it and i doesnt do nothing after pickup linux normal startup or recovery mode.. just a black screen...
